News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
OpenAI Is Preparing To Launch A Social App For AI-Generated Videos
| Wired.com | September 29, 2025
OpenAI is set to release a new app that leverages its Sora 2 video generation model for creating short, AI-generated video clips reminiscent of TikTok. The app includes user verification features and has already received positive feedback from internal testing, while also facing scrutiny over copyright and child safety issues.
B.)
Claude For Chrome Brings AI Where You‚Äôre Already Working
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | September 29, 2025
The new Claude for Chrome extension, powered by Sonnet 4.5, enhances productivity by enabling Claude to interact with web elements directly. Users can navigate the internet seamlessly with Claude‚Äôs assistance, making online tasks more efficient.
C.)
Create Polished Files In Minutes With Sonnet 4.5
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | September 29, 2025
Sonnet 4.5 is designed to streamline the creation of essential documents, presentations, and spreadsheets, enhancing productivity for complex tasks. With the ability to download and edit files seamlessly, Claude simplifies document generation, empowering users to accomplish more in less time.
D.)
The 20 Inventions That Will Change Your Life in 2026
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | September 29, 2025
Explore groundbreaking technologies poised to transform life by 2026. From advances in AI and medicine to smart devices and sustainable innovations, these inventions promise to reshape industries and address pressing global challenges.
E.)
Google Flow Launches Nano Banana Editing And Prompt Expander As Veo 2 Is Phased Out
| TestingCatalog.com | September 28, 2025
Google Flow now introduces a Nano Banana editing option and prompt expander, fueling a refined image generation process while Veo 2 phases out.
October 7, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | October 7, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
October 6, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
When You Hate Your AI Clone
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs Sora 2 pushes the boundaries of AI creativity in a humorous short that examines the implications of an AI outshining its human creator. Blending generated visuals with live-action, the project highlights the evolving landscape of AI-assisted filmmaking and the compelling narratives that arise when technology and humanity intersect.
6.)
A Once-in-a-Century Proof: The Kakeya Conjecture
| Quanta Magazine | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
Mathematicians Hong Wang and Joshua Zahl reveal a groundbreaking resolution to the Kakeya conjecture, elucidating its profound implications for modern analysis. This pivotal discovery intricately weaves together the concepts of geometry, fractals, and wave behavior, promising to transform our understanding of the Fourier transform.
7.)
Apps In ChatGPT
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
The integration of apps into ChatGPT signifies a new era of interaction, allowing users to engage seamlessly with various applications. With rollout support for Free, Go, Plus, and Pro users outside the EU, further partnerships and capabilities are set to enhance user experience in the coming weeks.
8.)
Claude Coded: Sonnet 4.5, Claude Code 2.0, And More.
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
Developers gain insights into the latest enhancements in the Claude ecosystem, featuring the introduction of Claude Sonnet 4.5 and critical upgrades to Claude Code. New API capabilities and distinct features within the Claude app are set to enhance developer productivity and creativity.
9.)
Intro To Agent Builder
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 6, 2025
Christina Huang from OpenAI introduces Agent Builder, showcasing its user-friendly visual interface for creating dynamic agentic workflows. With features like drag-and-drop nodes and easy tool connections, users can efficiently publish workflows using ChatKit and the Agents SDK.
10.)
Everything That Happened In AI This Weekend
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 6, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs Sora 2 updates and a new agent builder were announced, along with the introduction of a mysterious Cheetah model. Sam Altman shared plans for revenue-sharing on Sora 2, and researchers have developed an AI powered by actual human brain cells, highlighting significant developments in AI technology.
11.)
ChatGPT Apps Are Live: Here Are The First Ones You Can Try
| TheVerge.com | October 6, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs new ChatGPT SDK allows integrations with various apps such as Zillow, Canva, and Spotify. Users can directly interact with these applications through ChatGPT, facilitating tasks like creating a playlist, generating design previews, or searching for real estate listings.
12.)
Google‚Äôs AI Bounty Program Pays Bug Hunters Up To $30K
| TheVerge.com | October 6, 2025
Google has introduced a new AI vulnerability reward program that offers bug hunters up to $30,000 for identifying ways its AI products could be manipulated to perform rogue actions. The program emphasizes the need to find bugs that pose significant security risks, distinguishing them from lesser issues, and has already rewarded researchers over $430,000 in the past two years.
13.)
Google‚Äôs Answer To GPT-5 Might Be Days Away As Gemini 3 Launch Touted
| Digitaltrends.com | October 6, 2025
Developers have noted hints of Google‚Äôs Gemini 3 being tested ahead of its potential launch. With performance improvements in coding and creative tasks, it signals a competitive edge aimed at rivals like OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-5, while the upcoming October 9 livestream is set to reveal more about these advancements.
14.)
MrBeast Says AI Could Threaten Creators‚Äô Livelihoods, Calling It ‚ÄòScary Times‚Äô For The Industry
| TechCrunch.com | October 6, 2025
Top YouTube creator MrBeast expresses concern over AI‚Äôs impact on the livelihoods of content creators, questioning how AI-generated videos could affect those making a living from traditional content creation. His apprehension comes after the launch of OpenAI‚Äôs new audio and video generator, raising fears among creators about the future competition from AI technologies.
15.)
Zillow, ChatGPT Launch App Integration
| HousingWire.com | October 6, 2025
Zillow has integrated its real estate listings into ChatGPT, enabling users to search for properties via conversation. This unique partnership allows inquiries about home features and brings relevant listings with details and images right within ChatGPT.
16.)
Spotify Launches Personalized Music Recommendations Via ChatGPT Integration
| Newsroom.spotify.com | October 6, 2025
Spotify is everywhere you listen (and watch): in the car, on your TV, and even while gaming, with integrations across more than 2,000 devices. Every listener‚Äôs journey is unique; that‚Äôs why we‚Äôve built Spotify to be never more than a tap away from your next favorite track, playlist, or podcast.
17.)
OpenAI Codex Now Generally Available With New SDK, Slack Integration, And Admin Tools For Developers
| OpenAI.com | October 6, 2025
We‚Äôre announcing the general availability of Codex and three new features that make it even more useful for engineering teams.
18.)
OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Apps And New Apps SDK For Developers To Build Chat-Based Applications
| OpenAI.com | October 6, 2025
Today we‚Äôre introducing a new generation of apps you can chat with, right inside ChatGPT. Developers can start building them today with the new Apps SDK, available in preview.
19.)
OpenAI Launches AgentKit With New Tools For Building, Deploying, And Optimizing AI Agents
| OpenAI.com | October 6, 2025
Today we‚Äôre launching AgentKit, a complete set of tools for developers and enterprises to build, deploy, and optimize agents. Until now, building agents meant juggling fragmented tools, complex orchestration with no versioning, custom connectors, manual eval pipelines, prompt tuning, and weeks of frontend work before launch. With AgentKit, developers can now design workflows visually and embed agentic UIs faster using new building blocks.
20.)
Anthropic Releases Petri, An Open-Source Tool To Enhance Automated AI Safety Research And Auditing
| Anthropic.com | October 6, 2025
Petri (Parallel Exploration Tool for Risky Interactions) is our new open-source tool that enables researchers to explore hypotheses about model behavior with ease. Petri deploys an automated agent to test a target AI system through diverse multi-turn conversations involving simulated users and tools; Petri then scores and summarizes the target‚Äôs behavior.
21.)
Anthropic Partners With Deloitte To Deploy Claude AI To 470,000 Employees In Major Enterprise Rollout
| Anthropic.com | October 6, 2025
Anthropic and Deloitte today announced an expanded alliance that will make Claude available to Deloitte people across its global network and develop new industry-specific solutions powered by Claude. As part of the collaboration, Deloitte will establish a Claude Center of Excellence with trained specialists who will develop implementation frameworks, share leading practices across deployments, and provide ongoing technical support to create the systems needed to move AI pilots to production at scale. The collaboration represents Anthropic‚Äôs largest enterprise AI deployment to date, available to more than 470,000 Deloitte people.
22.)
OpenAI Unveils Hacktivate AI Report To Accelerate AI Adoption And Innovation Across Europe
| OpenAI.com | October 6, 2025
OpenAI and Allied for Startups today announced the release of the Hacktivate AI report, a collection of 20 ideas to accelerate broad-based AI adoption in Europe and boost the bloc‚Äôs competitiveness. The release comes just days before the European Commission is expected to unveil its Apply AI Strategy, a plan to encourage the real use of AI across business and the public sector.
23.)
AMD And OpenAI Partner To Deploy 6 Gigawatts Of AMD GPUs For Next-Gen AI Infrastructure
| OpenAI.com | October 6, 2025
AMD and OpenAI today announced a 6 gigawatt agreement to power OpenAI‚Äôs next-generation AI infrastructure across multiple generations of AMD Instinct GPUs. The first 1 gigawatt deployment of AMD Instinct MI450 GPUs is set to begin in the second half of 2026.
October 5, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
24.)
Almost Timely News: Is AI Going To Take Your Job?
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | October 5, 2025
An exploration into the implications of artificial intelligence on the job market reveals critical insights about evolving skill sets. Discover how AI tools can assess extensive scientific research quickly and what this means for your career trajectory in a rapidly changing economy.
25.)
OpenAI New Sora 2 Just Killed Google‚Äôs VEO 3‚Ä¶
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | October 5, 2025
In a detailed comparison of Sora 2 and Veo 3, key strengths and weaknesses of each video generation model are unveiled, highlighting significant advancements in Sora 2 that set new standards in AI video technology. Visual prompts showcasing movement and dynamic scenes reveal Sora 2‚Äôs reduced visual glitches, prompting crucial insights for content creators and studios considering their next technological investment.
26.)
Brain Cells Create Illusions That May Explain Schizoaffective Disorder
| WashingtonPost.com | October 5, 2025
Research suggests that specific brain cell interactions may contribute to the perception of illusions in individuals with schizoaffective disorder. The findings provide insights into the neural mechanisms underlying the disorder and could inform future treatment strategies.
October 4, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
27.)
Everything Free You Can Do With Gemini
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | October 4, 2025
Explore the extensive capabilities of Gemini, with a focus on practical features and integrations that can enhance AI workflows. This session highlights innovative applications and the various free tools available, empowering viewers to leverage AI effectively in their professional endeavors.
October 3, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
28.)
10 Perplexity Comet Agents To Automate Your Work (AI Browser)
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | October 3, 2025
Discover how Perplexity‚Äôs Comet transforms the browsing experience into a powerful AI tool designed to automate various tasks. From facilitating research to monitoring leads, explore ten innovative applications that can enhance productivity and streamline your workflow.
29.)
These OpenAI Releases Are Insane & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | October 3, 2025
Igor explores the latest innovations from OpenAI, including the Sora 2 video model and the new parental controls for ChatGPT. He also tests exciting AI features in Photoshop such as Nano Banana editing, while discussing the implications of these developments in the field of artificial intelligence.
30.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Sora 2: Future of Media or AI SLOPOCALYPSE??
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | October 3, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs Sora 2 prompts a deep dive into its groundbreaking capabilities and the implications of its Cameo feature, which allows the creation of personalized videos. The discussion also addresses concerns surrounding intellectual property infringement and how innovative AI technologies are redefining content production processes.
31.)
How to Use Sora App: OpenAI‚Äôs Video Generator Hands-On Demo
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | October 3, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey explore OpenAI‚Äôs Sora 2, an innovative AI video platform that combines elements of social media and meme generation. They delve into its distinctive features, including the cameo system and remix capabilities, while providing insights on effective prompting techniques and the broader context of AI-generated content in today‚Äôs digital landscape.
32.)
How One AI Model Creates a Physical Intuition of Its Environment
| QuantaMagazine.org | October 3, 2025
Researchers have developed an AI system called Video Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture (V-JEPA) that learns about physics through video observation.
33.)
Sam Altman Says The GPT-5 Haters Got It All Wrong
| Wired.com | October 3, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman addresses the backlash against GPT-5, arguing that the model‚Äôs perceived shortcomings are a misunderstanding of its capabilities. He emphasizes its importance in advancing scientific discovery and asserts that future iterations, GPT-6 and GPT-7, will surpass GPT-5 significantly.
34.)
IBM Just Beat Models 12X Its Size
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 3, 2025
IBM has launched the Granite 4.0 open-source model, which operates with 70% less memory and outperforms larger models. Concurrently, OpenAI‚Äôs valuation reached $500 billion, establishing it as the world‚Äôs most valuable private company.
October 2, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
35.)
Building The Future Of Agents With Claude
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
Alex Albert, Brad Abrams, and Katelyn Lesse engage in an in-depth discussion on the progressive development of AI agents through the Claude Developer Platform. Key features and best practices for maximizing agent efficiency are explored, highlighting the importance of utilizing innovative tools to enhance model performance.
36.)
How To Build AI Agents To Automate EVERYTHING (N8N Tutorial)
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
Unlock the potential of automation by creating AI agents with N8N, a versatile tool that enables users to build custom workflows for various tasks. Learn how to host your agent on Hostinger, transforming the way you automate processes and maximize efficiency.
37.)
Introducing AndThen. Play The Conversation.
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
AndThen is revolutionizing real-time voice interactions by allowing users to engage with AI characters with unique scenarios crafted by humans. This platform incorporates personalized voice conversations that adapt to each user‚Äôs input, providing an interactive experience that blurs the lines between human and AI engagement.
38.)
Sora 2 Is Unbelievable‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
Sora 2 unveils a world of possibilities in AI technology, showcasing breathtaking examples of its capabilities across various domains, including physics and motion graphics. Users can also expect insights on its application in creative fields, driving innovation and creativity to new heights.
39.)
Sora Is More Powerful Than You Thought
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
Open AI‚Äôs Sora 2 is examined through a lens that blends playful and practical applications, revealing its capabilities beyond surface-level memes. Key features such as cameo integration and storytelling enhancements are scrutinized to illustrate how Sora is edging closer to professional cinematic production.
40.)
Top 15 New Technology Trends That Will Decide Who Rules The World
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | October 2, 2025
The future of global power is increasingly tied to cutting-edge technologies that influence economies and governance worldwide. Breakthroughs in areas such as artificial intelligence, quantum computing, and biotechnology will play crucial roles in determining which nations and companies emerge dominant.
41.)
AI‚Äôs Newest Flex: Robot Armies That Do Chemistry
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 2, 2025
The article covers the launch of Sora 2, which has ignited debate in the tech industry, highlighting a shift in priorities regarding AI‚Äôs potential for scientific advancements versus commercial exploitation. Periodic Labs, backed by significant funding, aims to develop AI systems that can conduct real experimental chemistry, addressing the limitations of existing models that excel in theoretical applications but struggle with practical experimentation.
October 1, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
42.)
OpenAI Beats Every Human Team at World‚Äôs Hardest Coding Competition
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | October 1, 2025
OpenAI achieved a historic milestone at the ICPC by solving all 12 problems in the world finals, outpacing human competitors. Research lead Ahmed El-Kishky reveals critical insights on their journey, including groundbreaking self-testing strategies and the importance of foundational programming skills amidst rapid advancements in AI.
43.)
Sora 2 ‚Äì It Will Only Get More Realistic From Here
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | October 1, 2025
Sora 2 marks a pivotal moment in AI development, sparking discussions about its potential as a generalist agent versus the perceived hype surrounding its rollout. The analysis covers key contrasts with previous models, insights from Claude Sonnet 4.5, and thoughts on future advancements.
44.)
Claude 4.5! (30 Hours of Thinking!)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 1, 2025
Explore the capabilities of Claude 4.5, showcasing 30 hours of rigorous thinking and innovative AI applications. Learn how you can leverage this tool to maximize efficiency and enhance your projects.
45.)
Connect Slack to Claude with MCP
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 1, 2025
Integrating Slack with Claude via the Slack MCP server enables seamless access to vital information from workspace channels, direct messages, and shared files. Claude enhances meeting preparations by extracting relevant discussions, compiling project updates, and identifying action items from team conversations, all within a single chat interface.
46.)
Meet Sora 2: OpenAI‚Äôs New ‚ÄúMulti-Player Meme Creation Machine‚Äù
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 1, 2025
OpenAI has launched Sora 2, featuring innovative tools for meme creation that blend video with user-generated content. The new app enables a unique social experience by allowing users to drop their likeness into various AI-generated scenes, enhancing interactivity and creativity while raising important privacy considerations.
October 2, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
47.)
Factory.AI Releases Comprehensive Guide To Building Software Development Agent Teams
| Siddharthbharath.com | October 2, 2025
Last week, Factory gave us a masterclass in how to launch a product in a crowded space. While every major AI company and their aunt already has a CLI coding agent, all I kept hearing about was Factory and their Droid agents.
48.)
OpenAI Surpasses SpaceX As World‚Äôs Most Valuable Startup With $500 Billion Valuation
| FinancialPost.com | October 2, 2025
Current and former OpenAI employees sold about US$6.6 billion of stock to investors.
49.)
Google Expands Jules AI Coding Agent With New Command-Line Tools And Early Access To Jules API
| Blog.google | October 2, 2025
Jules Tools is our new, lightweight command-line interface. And Jules API will let you integrate Jules directly into your own systems.
50.)
Comet Launches Free Web Browser, Now Available To Everyone Worldwide
| Perplexity.ai | October 2, 2025
Today we are releasing the Comet browser to the world, for free. We first launched Comet to limited release on July 9. Ever since, millions of people have joined the waitlist to receive Comet, faster than we‚Äôve been able to release it. It has become the most sought-after AI product of the year, no matter how fast we release invites.
October 1, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
51.)
Thinking Machines Lab, Led By Ex-OpenAI Staff, Debuts First Product Focused On Fine-Tuning AI Models
| Wired.com | October 1, 2025
Thinking Machines Lab, led by a group of prominent former OpenAI researchers, is betting that fine-tuning cutting-edge models will be the next frontier in AI.
52.)
Meta To Use Data From AI Chat Interactions To Target Ads On Facebook And Instagram
| TechCrunch.com | October 1, 2025
Meta announced on Wednesday that data collected from user interactions with its AI products will soon be used to sell targeted ads across its social media platforms.
53.)
Hume AI Launches Octave 2, Its Next-Generation Multilingual Voice AI Model For Text-To-Speech
| Hume.ai | October 1, 2025
Today we‚Äôre launching Octave (Omni capable text and voice engine) 2, the second generation of our frontier voice AI model for text-to-speech. We just made a preview of Octave 2 available on our platform and through our API.
54.)
Apple Halts Vision Pro Revamp To Focus On Developing AI Smart Glasses Competing With Meta
| Bloomberg.com | October 1, 2025
Apple Inc. has hit pause on a planned overhaul to its Vision Pro headset to redirect resources toward a more urgent effort: developing smart glasses that can rival products from Meta Platforms Inc.
55.)
Anthropic‚Äôs Claude Powers Enterprise AI For Novo Nordisk, Salesforce, Cox Automotive, More
| Anthropic.com | October 1, 2025
As the leader in enterprise AI, Anthropic builds state-of-the-art models specializing in industries where precision matters, from coding and cybersecurity to financial services. Claude Sonnet 4.5, our latest release, delivers measurable results‚Äîreducing vulnerability response time by 44% for security organizations like HackerOne, enabling investment-grade financial analysis at institutional firms like NBIM, and helping developers at Netflix and GitHub tackle complex, codebase-spanning tasks with unprecedented accuracy.
56.)
Anthropic Integrates Claude With Slack, Enabling Direct App Access And Smarter Message Referencing
| Anthropic.com | October 1, 2025
We‚Äôre introducing two ways to use Claude with Slack. Add Claude directly to your Slack workspace, or connect Slack to the Claude apps so Claude can search and reference relevant Slack messages during conversations.
57.)
Samsung And SK Partner With OpenAI On Stargate To Boost Global AI Chip Production And Data Centers
| OpenAI.com | October 1, 2025
Samsung, SK, and OpenAI today announced new strategic partnerships as part of OpenAI‚Äôs Stargate initiative, the company‚Äôs overarching AI infrastructure platform, aimed at expanding infrastructure critical to AI development, globally and in Korea.
58.)
Peloton Adds AI, Form-Checking Cameras, And Rotating Screens To Bike, Tread, And Row Machines
| Engadget.com | October 1, 2025
It‚Äôs been a rough time for Peloton. Last year was marred by deep staff cuts, a change of CEO and a reckoning of where the home fitness company belonged, post-Pandemic boom. The answer is, unfortunately, AI-tinged, but that shouldn‚Äôt distract from some major hardware upgrades across its Bike, Tread and Row family of machines. It‚Äôs an almost-entire overhaul, with new software, programmable workouts and an array of collaborations. There are also some tentative steps toward wellness, because why not?
59.)
Amazon Unveils AI-Powered Kindle Feature, Enhancing E-Reader Experience With Advanced Technology
| CNet.com | October 1, 2025
If you‚Äôre the type of reader who picks up their book after a few days off (or even one) and thinks, ‚ÄúWhat in the world is happening here?‚Äù Amazon‚Äôs new Kindle Scribe models, announced Tuesday, have an AI feature that solves the problem.
60.)
Wikimedia Launches AI-Friendly Database To Simplify Data Search On Wikidata For Developers And Users
| TheVerge.com | October 1, 2025
Wikipedia‚Äôs sister project Wikidata just got a new database that is easier for AI models to ingest.
61.)
Sony Adds Audio Sharing To Flagship Headphones With New Firmware Update For Android Users
| TheVerge.com | October 1, 2025
New firmware updates are available through Sony‚Äôs Sound Connect mobile app.
62.)
Thinking Machines Lab, Led By Ex-OpenAI Researchers, Debuts First AI Product Focused On Fine-Tuning Models
| Wired.com | October 1, 2025
Thinking Machines Lab, led by a group of prominent former OpenAI researchers, is betting that fine-tuning cutting-edge models will be the next frontier in AI.
63.)
Yale Study Finds AI Has Had No Impact On Jobs So Far
| Budgetlab.yale.edu | October 1, 2025
While the occupational mix is changing more quickly than it has in the past, it is not a large difference and predates the widespread introduction of AI in the workforce.
64.)
Google Opens Applications For Global AI Film Award With $1 Million Prize For AI Film Creators
| Blog.google | October 1, 2025
Storytellers globally can now participate in the AI Film Award, with a prize of USD $1 million presented by the 1 Billion Followers Summit. Submissions are open until November 20, 2025, and the film needs to be generated by Google‚Äôs AI models and tools including Gemini, Flow and others.
65.)
Meta To Use AI Interactions To Personalize Content And Ads Across Its Apps
| About.fb.com | October 1, 2025
We will start personalizing content and ad recommendations on our platforms based on people‚Äôs interactions with our generative AI features.
66.)
Google Unveils New Gemini-Powered Nest Cams And Home Speaker For Smarter Connected Homes
| Blog.google | October 1, 2025
Check out the next generation of Gemini-powered Nest Cams and Doorbell, and the new Google Home Speaker.
67.)
Microsoft Launches Agent Framework To Streamline Multi-Agent System Orchestration For Developers
| Azure.microsoft.com | October 1, 2025
Today we‚Äôre announcing new capabilities in Azure AI Foundry that make it easier for developers to build, observe, and govern multi-agent systems, while helping organizations close the trust gap in AI.
September 30, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
68.)
I‚Äôm Giving You My Favorite Business Automation For Free
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | September 30, 2025
Learn to create a personalized AI automation that has been pivotal for The AI Advantage business over the past year. With practical tips and a customizable blueprint, users can harness the power of automation to enhance their efficiency and productivity.
69.)
Sora 2 Bombshell! It‚Äôs Free and Here!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | September 30, 2025
OpenAI has unveiled Sora 2, an innovative video and audio generation model that is now available for free. With features like 16-second 1080p video clips and enhanced audio synchronization, this release represents a significant improvement from its predecessor and positions OpenAI strongly in the competitive landscape of AI video creation.
70.)
The $100M Marketing Strategy Behind Clay AI
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | September 30, 2025
Varun Anand shares insights into Clay‚Äôs innovative brand strategies, emphasizing creativity and bold marketing approaches. The conversation explores their unique marketing stunts, the importance of real-world experiences, and how diversification in hiring fuels their AI platform‚Äôs success.
71.)
This Is Sora 2
